snippet: If circumstances and his own political skill allowed President Obama to run in 2008 as something other than an ordinary politician, this time around he faces all the challenges, and carries much of the baggage, of any other standard-issue Democrat.
abstract: If circumstances and his own political skill allowed President Obama to run in 2008 as something other than an ordinary politician, this time around he faces all the challenges, and carries much of the baggage, of any other standard-issue Democrat.
lead_paragraph: 2:55 p.m. | Updated "One of the things about being president," President Obama said the other day in an interview with NBC News, "is that you get better as time goes on."
